channel.title: Java not recognised on vps - please help! teamviewer pl0x!?
channel.description:
Everytime i open run.bat this error comes up, after i have downloaded java on my vps it still does not recognise! Help! C:\Documents and Settings\Administrator\Desktop\RuneLord Source>java -noverify - javaagent:"C:\Program Files\ZeroTurnaround\JRebel\jrebel.jar" server 'java' is not recognized as an internal or external command, operable program or batch file.
C:\Documents and Settings\Administrator\Desktop\RuneLord Source>pause Press any key to continue . . .

item.title: Java not recognised on vps - please help! teamviewer pl0x!?
item.dc:creator: @Fender94 Fender94
item.description:
@Fender94 wrote:

Sure, ill pm you. Or pm me your id and pass.

Read full topic

item.title: Java not recognised on vps - please help! teamviewer pl0x!?
item.dc:creator: @123kdd100 123kdd100
item.description:
@123kdd100 wrote:

[quote=“Fender94, post:5, topic:355105”]You can just put it the full directory of your current java version?
for example:

“C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jdk1.6.0_21\bin\java.exe” -noverify -javaagent:“C:\Program Files\ZeroTurnaround\JRebel\jrebel.jar” server[/quote]
i kinda got it, can you help on teamviewer? please i got this vps yesterday and i dont want to waste…!

Read full topic

item.title: Java not recognised on vps - please help! teamviewer pl0x!?
item.dc:creator: @Shadowspkin Shadowspkin
item.description:
@Shadowspkin wrote:

Download java, Right click run\compile what ever it is and click edit. Once you go there go to my computer and click c see if you have a Program files(x86) if you do you need change the Program Files to Porgram Files(x86) also if you dont have program files(x86) try going into your normal Program files and look for java and then look at the version and change your thing to your current java…,http://download.oracle.com/javase/tutorial/essential/environment/paths.html,

Read full topic

item.title: Java not recognised on vps - please help! teamviewer pl0x!?
item.dc:creator: @TheEndGame TheEndGame
item.description:
@TheEndGame wrote:

Did you set your environmentable variables?

Also, right click run.bat. Look for the java path, and check to see if it is the same for where your computers java is.

Read full topic
